analyzed: gnas shes pa yi gnas rnams ni //
translated: The places to be known are

original: rtogs par byas la'ang 'bras bu brjod //
analyzed: rtogs par byas la'ang 'bras bu brjod //
translated: also expressed as results when realized.

original: tshe dang na tshod cha rnams ni //
analyzed: tshe dang na tshod cha rnams ni //
translated: Life and age are taught

original: gnas las shes par byas te bstan //
analyzed: gnas las shes par byas te bstan //
translated: having been known from the places.

original: mtshan nyid ldan na 'bras bur bcas //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ldan na 'bras bur bcas //
translated: If endowed with characteristics, [it] has results;

original: go bzlog pa ni 'bras bu med //
analyzed: go bzlog pa ni 'bras bu med //
translated: if reversed, [it] is without results.

original: mtshan nyid gnas ni 'khrug pa las //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gnas ni 'khrug pa las //
translated: From the disturbance of the characteristic places,

original: 'bras bu khyad par 'phags par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu khyad par 'phags par 'gyur //
translated: the result becomes especially exalted.

original: mdog dang gzi mdangs snying stobs dri //
analyzed: mdog dang gzi mdangs snying stobs dri //
translated: Color, luster, courage, and smell,

original: ci bzhin dus su 'bras bu ster //
analyzed: ci bzhin dus su 'bras bu ster //
translated: And in due season, fruit.

original: lus kyi 'gros dang skad dang ni //
analyzed: lus kyi 'gros dang skad dang ni //
translated: The gait and voice of the body

original: rtag tu 'bras bu 'byin pa yin //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bras bu 'byin pa yin //
translated: Always give rise to fruit.

original: thig le dang ni gtsug gi ni //
analyzed: thig le dang ni gtsug gi ni //
translated: The state of the bindu and the crown

original: gnas skabs cha ni 'di las byung //
analyzed: gnas skabs cha ni 'di las byung //
translated: Arise from this part.

original: sha li ho tra'i mdo'i gnas las yan lag bcu'i cha dbye ba'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: sha li ho tra'i mdo'i gnas las yan lag bcu'i cha dbye ba'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twelfth chapter of the Questions of Śālihotra Tantra, the section on the analysis of the parts of the ten limbs.

original: // / legs thos thos pa phun tshogs pas //
analyzed: // / legs thos thos pa phun tshogs pas //
translated: Having heard well, with perfect hearing,

original: sha li ho tra la dris pa //
analyzed: sha li ho tra la dris pa //
translated: Śālihotra was asked:

original: mi sdug ci ltar shes par gyis //
analyzed: mi sdug ci ltar shes par gyis //
translated: “How should one know what is ugly?

original: ji bzhin sdug pa ji lta bu //
analyzed: ji bzhin sdug pa ji lta bu //
translated: And how is it that something is beautiful?🔽Inferior and likewise non-inferior,🔽Complete and incomplete limbs,🔽Measurable and immeasurable,

original: dman dang de bzhin mi dman dang // yan lag tshang dang mi tshang dang // gzhal bya nyid dang gzhal min dang // gso sla gso dka' ji lta bu//
analyzed: dman dang de bzhin mi dman dang // yan lag tshang dang mi tshang dang // gzhal bya nyid dang gzhal min dang // gso sla gso dka' ji lta bu//
translated: Easy and difficult to cure—how is it?”

original: @182a * // de ltar bu yis dris pa dang // sha li ho tras slar smras pa //
analyzed: @182a * // de ltar bu yis dris pa dang // sha li ho tras slar smras pa //
translated: Thus asked, Śālihotra replied:

original: so so'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba //
analyzed: so so'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba //
translated: “The individual characteristics,

original: de dag khyed la bshad par bya //
analyzed: de dag khyed la bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain them to you.

original: gang yang lus kyi dbyibs legs shing //
analyzed: gang yang lus kyi dbyibs legs shing //
translated: Also, the body has a good shape,

original: rtsa rgyus snang bar mi 'gyur dang // chu zheng tshad dang ldan pa dang // sha ni gnas dang 'tsham par skyes //
analyzed: rtsa rgyus snang bar mi 'gyur dang // chu zheng tshad dang ldan pa dang // sha ni gnas dang 'tsham par skyes //
translated: the veins and tendons do not show, it is proportionate in height and breadth, and the flesh is well-placed.

original: lus snyoms gsus pa chung ba dang // yid dang mig ni dga' byed pa //
analyzed: lus snyoms gsus pa chung ba dang // yid dang mig ni dga' byed pa //
translated: The body is even, the belly is small, and it delights the mind and the eyes.🔽The lower part of the body is even and round, beautiful and well-shaped,🔽the limbs and digits are complete, the shape of all the limbs is good, the minor parts are not ugly,

original: ro smad mnyam zhing zlum pa dang / mdzes shing dbyibs ni legs gnas dang // yan lag nyid lag rdzogs pa dang // yan lag kun gyi dbyibs legs dang // nying lag rnams ni mi sdug dang // mgyogs shing mnyam dang ldan pa dang // des shing stobs dang ldan pa dang //
analyzed: ro smad mnyam zhing zlum pa dang / mdzes shing dbyibs ni legs gnas dang // yan lag nyid lag rdzogs pa dang // yan lag kun gyi dbyibs legs dang // nying lag rnams ni mi sdug dang // mgyogs shing mnyam dang ldan pa dang // des shing stobs dang ldan pa dang //
translated: it is quick and even, gentle and strong,

original: na tshod gzhon zhing 'gros che dang // ske mgrin phrag so brang gi phyogs //
analyzed: na tshod gzhon zhing 'gros che dang // ske mgrin phrag so brang gi phyogs //
translated: youthful and with a large stride, the neck, shoulders, and chest

original: sha rgyas tshad dang ldan la sogs //
analyzed: sha rgyas tshad dang ldan la sogs //
translated: are full of flesh, and so forth.

original: 'di dag gzhal bya cha mnyam dang // gso sla mi sdug med pa yin //
analyzed: 'di dag gzhal bya cha mnyam dang // gso sla mi sdug med pa yin //
translated: These are the things to be assessed: evenness, ease of treatment, and absence of ugliness.

original: de las bzlog par gyur ba'i rta //
analyzed: de las bzlog par gyur ba'i rta //
translated: A horse that is the opposite of this

original: gzhal bya'i las dag ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya'i las dag ma yin no //
translated: But not the object of evaluation.

original: de lta'i mi sdug la sogs dang // ldan pa'i rta ni gang yin pa //
analyzed: de lta'i mi sdug la sogs dang // ldan pa'i rta ni gang yin pa //
translated: The horse that is endowed with ugliness and so forth,

original: shing rta lam dang khal dang ni //
analyzed: shing rta lam dang khal dang ni //
translated: In the chariot, on the road, and in the burden,

original: rtsed mo'i gnas dang g-yul dag tu //
analyzed: rtsed mo'i gnas dang g-yul dag tu //
translated: And in the field of play and in battle,

original: las dang 'tsham pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: las dang 'tsham pa ma yin pas //
translated: Is not suitable for the task.

original: de phyir de ni spang bar bya //
analyzed: de phyir de ni spang bar bya //
translated: Therefore, it should be abandoned.

original: de phyir bzang po shes byas la //
analyzed: de phyir bzang po shes byas la //
translated: Therefore, having understood the good,

original: de lta'i rta ni blang bar bya //
analyzed: de lta'i rta ni blang bar bya //
translated: That kind of horse should be accepted.

original: de ltar blang 'os blangs nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar blang 'os blangs nas ni //
translated: Having accepted what is worthy of acceptance,

original: lhag ma spang bya rnam par spang //
analyzed: lhag ma spang bya rnam par spang //
translated: The rest should be abandoned.

original: tshong pa rnams la rta dag ni //
analyzed: tshong pa rnams la rta dag ni //
translated: For the merchants, the horses

original: bzang po blang bar gyur pa dang // spris ma bshugs pa'i zho lta bur //
analyzed: bzang po blang bar gyur pa dang // spris ma bshugs pa'i zho lta bur //
translated: Are good to accept, and like milk from which the cream has been removed,

original: lhag ma snying po med pa yin //
analyzed: lhag ma snying po med pa yin //
translated: The rest is without essence.

original: de lta mod kyi brtse ba yis //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi brtse ba yis //
translated: However, out of affection,🔽That which is to be abandoned should also be accepted,

original: spang bya de yang tshong ba dang // rta la brtse bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: spang bya de yang tshong ba dang // rta la brtse bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to be kind to the merchants and the horse,

original: blangs te sbyin pa gtang bar bya //
analyzed: blangs te sbyin pa gtang bar bya //
translated: And then given away as a gift.

original: mtshan ni ngan par gyur na yang //
analyzed: mtshan ni ngan par gyur na yang //
translated: Even if the signs are bad,

original: mgyogs shing rigs dang na tshod ldan //🔽rgyal pos lhag gang rnams dang ni //
analyzed: mgyogs shing rigs dang na tshod ldan // rgyal pos lhag gang rnams dang ni //
translated: He should be quick, of good family, and young.🔽The king should give to the Brahmins

original: bram ze la ni sbyin par bya //
analyzed: bram ze la ni sbyin par bya //
translated: whatever is left over.🔽He should give to the men of the neighboring countries

original: ma ning rgan dang nad kyis nyen //🔽nye 'khor gnas pa'i mi la sbyin //
analyzed: ma ning rgan dang nad kyis nyen // nye 'khor gnas pa'i mi la sbyin //
translated: the eunuchs, the old, and the sick.

original: rlig pa med dang rlig gcig pa //
analyzed: rlig pa med dang rlig gcig pa //
translated: He should give to the impotent, the one-eyed, the blind,🔽the lame, the deaf, and the dumb,🔽the hermaphrodites, and so forth.🔽He should give to the dancers, singers,

original: rlig ser dang ni lus skems dang // yan lag ma tshang gyur pa dag / nyung rum la sogs rnams la @182b sbyin ;
analyzed: rlig ser dang ni lus skems dang // yan lag ma tshang gyur pa dag / nyung rum la sogs rnams la @182b sbyin ;
translated: bathers, and barbers

original: / g-yul du 'jug par mi nus pa //🔽gar mkhan dang ni glu mkhan dang // 'khrus mkhan dang ni 'dreg mkhan dang // de 'dra'i tshul ldan dag la sbyin //🔽de la shin tu mi sdug pa //
analyzed: / g-yul du 'jug par mi nus pa // gar mkhan dang ni glu mkhan dang // 'khrus mkhan dang ni 'dreg mkhan dang // de 'dra'i tshul ldan dag la sbyin // de la shin tu mi sdug pa //
translated: who are unable to engage in battle.🔽He should not give to the very ugly

original: shin tu bzang ba mi sbyin no //
analyzed: shin tu bzang ba mi sbyin no //
translated: or to the very beautiful.🔽He should give to the ugly, the ill-formed, the bad-smelling,

original: shu la ka dang gzugs mi sdug / so mi sdug dang mi srun pa //🔽nye 'khor gyi ni pho nya sogs //
analyzed: shu la ka dang gzugs mi sdug / so mi sdug dang mi srun pa // nye 'khor gyi ni pho nya sogs //
translated: the ill-mannered, the rude,🔽the messengers of the neighboring countries,

original: drag shul byed pa rnams la sbyin //
analyzed: drag shul byed pa rnams la sbyin //
translated: and to those who are violent.

original: 'gro sa chung ba dang sbegs pa dang // rkang ngan glas kyi nang mir sbyin //
analyzed: 'gro sa chung ba dang sbegs pa dang // rkang ngan glas kyi nang mir sbyin //
translated: To those who have little to eat, to those who are slow, to those who have bad feet, to those who are servants, to those who are poor.

original: rta la gdug par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: rta la gdug par gyur pa ni //
translated: To those who are cruel to horses,

original: mtshams srung mtha' 'khob pa dag dang // nyes pa cher bsten dag la sbyin //
analyzed: mtshams srung mtha' 'khob pa dag dang // nyes pa cher bsten dag la sbyin //
translated: to those who guard the borders, to those who live in the borderlands, to those who commit great offenses.🔽He should not keep them in his own country.

original: rang gi yul du de mi gzhag / de rnams rtog la mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: rang gi yul du de mi gzhag / de rnams rtog la mkhas pa ni //
translated: Those who are skilled in examining horses,🔽he should always keep them near the king.

original: rgyal po'i drung du rtag par gzhag / de ltar rta ni rnam phye na //
analyzed: rgyal po'i drung du rtag par gzhag / de ltar rta ni rnam phye na //
translated: In this way, having examined the horses,

original: rgyal po'i 'byor ba 'phel 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rgyal po'i 'byor ba 'phel 'gyur zhing //
translated: the king's wealth will increase.🔽His mind will be joyful and happy,

original: yid ni dga' zhing mgu ba dang // g-yul dang dgra las rgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yid ni dga' zhing mgu ba dang // g-yul dang dgra las rgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: and he will be victorious in battle and over enemies.

original: sha li ho tra'i mdo'i gnas las sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par phye ba'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sha li ho tra'i mdo'i gnas las sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par phye ba'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: This concludes the chapter on the distinction between the pleasant and the unpleasant, the thirteenth in the section on the abode of Śālihoṭra's sūtra.

original: nyi ma 'char ka 'dra ba yi //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka 'dra ba yi //
translated: Like the rising sun,

original: drang srong pha la phyag byas te //
analyzed: drang srong pha la phyag byas te //
translated: he bowed to the sage Phala.

original: legs thos kyis ni zas kyi tshad //
analyzed: legs thos kyis ni zas kyi tshad //
translated: Having heard well, he asked about the measure of food,

original: rnam par brtag pa dris gyur pa //
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa dris gyur pa //
translated: which was examined.

original: legs ldan mi la zas kyi tshad //
analyzed: legs ldan mi la zas kyi tshad //
translated: The virtuous one asked about the measure of food for humans,

original: bshad kyis rta la ci zhig 'tshal//🔽phyugs rnams dang ni khyad par du //
analyzed: bshad kyis rta la ci zhig 'tshal// phyugs rnams dang ni khyad par du //
translated: What do horses need to be explained?🔽They are no different from cattle.

original: rta la de gso ma mchis te //
analyzed: rta la de gso ma mchis te //
translated: Horses do not need to be raised.

original: de rnams dbugs 'byin tsam gyis ni //🔽zos shing bcas pa 'ju gyur la //
analyzed: de rnams dbugs 'byin tsam gyis ni // zos shing bcas pa 'ju gyur la //
translated: They are digested by the mere exhalation of breath.

original: phyugs ni lto bar grags pas na //
analyzed: phyugs ni lto bar grags pas na //
translated: Cattle are known to be in the belly.

original: de la tshad ni ci zhig bgyi //
analyzed: de la tshad ni ci zhig bgyi //
translated: What is the measure of that?

original: de skad legs thos kyis smras tshe //
analyzed: de skad legs thos kyis smras tshe //
translated: When this was said by Subhūti,

original: sha li ho tras slar smras pa//
analyzed: sha li ho tras slar smras pa//
translated: Śālihotra replied:

original: blo gros bzang po nan tan du //
analyzed: blo gros bzang po nan tan du //
translated: “Good-minded one,

original: shin tu 'drangs kyang tshad tsam du //
analyzed: shin tu 'drangs kyang tshad tsam du //
translated: even if you are very satisfied,

original: byin na dga' ba skyed byed cing //
analyzed: byin na dga' ba skyed byed cing //
translated: if you give to the proper extent, it produces joy.

original: tshod zin dug kyang bdud rtsir 'gyur //
analyzed: tshod zin dug kyang bdud rtsir 'gyur //
translated: Even poison becomes nectar if the right amount is taken.

original: tshod ma zin na bdud rtsis kyang //
analyzed: tshod ma zin na bdud rtsis kyang //
translated: If the right amount is not taken, even nectar

original: gsod par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gsod par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: can become a killer.

original: bde zhing gso la 'tsho byed pas //
analyzed: bde zhing gso la 'tsho byed pas //
translated: Since it is pleasant, nourishing, and life-giving,

original: tshod zin 'jig rten ma dang 'dra ;
analyzed: tshod zin 'jig rten ma dang 'dra ;
translated: the right amount is like a mother to the world.

original: / de med srog mtha'i 'jigs bskyed la //
analyzed: / de med srog mtha'i 'jigs bskyed la //
translated: Without it, it creates the fear of the end of life;

original: de dang ldan na gnas mchog 'gyur //
analyzed: de dang ldan na gnas mchog 'gyur //
translated: with it, it becomes the best of abodes.

original: rta ni mang du za bas na //
analyzed: rta ni mang du za bas na //
translated: Horses eat a lot,

original: tshad kyi dgos pa bden mod kyi //
analyzed: tshad kyi dgos pa bden mod kyi //
translated: The need for moderation is certainly true,🔽But even a donkey of poor constitution needs

original: sman dang zas skom cho ga ni //🔽'gro ngan bong bu la yang dgos //
analyzed: sman dang zas skom cho ga ni // 'gro ngan bong bu la yang dgos //
translated: Medicines, food and drink in the right proportions.

original: tshod ma zin na sman gyis kyang //
analyzed: tshod ma zin na sman gyis kyang //
translated: If the dosage is not right, even medicine

original: nad gzhan skyed bar 'gyur @183a * //🔽yin la // tshod dang ldan pa byas pa yis //
analyzed: nad gzhan skyed bar 'gyur @183a * // yin la // tshod dang ldan pa byas pa yis //
translated: Can give rise to other illnesses.🔽But if it is used in the right proportions,🔽Even poison can cure an illness.🔽The amount of food and drink that is right

original: dug gis kyang ni nad 'joms so //
analyzed: dug gis kyang ni nad 'joms so //
translated: Is determined by three factors:🔽The type of food, the strength of the digestive heat,🔽And the strength of the body.

original: rdzas dang 'ju stobs rdzas ci yang //
analyzed: rdzas dang 'ju stobs rdzas ci yang //
translated: The amount of food that is right is that which🔽Does not cause the heart to be unhappy,🔽Does not prevent the flow of urine and excrement,🔽Does not cause the stomach to be overly full,🔽Does not cause discomfort in the sides,

original: tshad ni rnam pa gsum la 'jug / snying dga' shugs ni ma bkag dang // lto la shin tu mi gnod dang // rtsib logs rnams ni bde ba dang // gsus pa tshim bar ma gyur la //
analyzed: tshad ni rnam pa gsum la 'jug / snying dga' shugs ni ma bkag dang // lto la shin tu mi gnod dang // rtsib logs rnams ni bde ba dang // gsus pa tshim bar ma gyur la //
translated: Does not cause the belly to become distended,🔽Does not cause the body to become heavy,🔽Does not cause the body to become weak,🔽Does not cause the body to become flaccid,🔽Does not cause the body to become stiff,🔽Does not cause the body to become agitated,🔽Does not cause the body to become too hot,🔽Does not cause the body to become too cold,🔽Does not cause the body to become too thin,🔽Does not cause the body to become too fat,🔽Does not cause the body to become too weak,

original: bkres dang skom ni zhi ba dang // dbang po rnams ni tshim pa dang // dbugs rngub dbugs dbyung bde ba dang // gnyid ni bde bar log byed dang // stobs dang kha dog 'phel byed dang // bde bar 'ju bar 'gyur ba dang // lus gzungs 'khrug par mi byed pa //
analyzed: bkres dang skom ni zhi ba dang // dbang po rnams ni tshim pa dang // dbugs rngub dbugs dbyung bde ba dang // gnyid ni bde bar log byed dang // stobs dang kha dog 'phel byed dang // bde bar 'ju bar 'gyur ba dang // lus gzungs 'khrug par mi byed pa //
translated: Does not cause the body to become too strong,🔽Does not cause the body to become too slow,🔽Does not cause the body to become too fast,🔽Does not cause the body to become too tight,🔽Does not cause the body to become too loose,🔽Does not cause the body to become too agitated,🔽Does not cause the body to become too dull,🔽Does not cause the body to become too excited,🔽Does not cause the body to become too depressed,🔽Does not cause the body to become too agitated,🔽Does not cause the body to become too dull,🔽Does not cause the body to become too excited,🔽Does not cause the body to become too depressed,🔽Does not cause the body to become too agitated,🔽Does not cause the body to become too dull,🔽Does not cause the body to become too excited,🔽Does not cause the body to become too depressed,🔽Does not cause the body to become too agitated,🔽Does not cause the body to become too dull,🔽Does not cause the body to become too excited,🔽Does not cause the body to become too depressed,🔽Does not cause the body

original: tshod zin zos pa yin par bshad //🔽kha zas lci bas lto ba yi //
analyzed: tshod zin zos pa yin par bshad // kha zas lci bas lto ba yi //
translated: It is said that one should eat in moderation.🔽It is recommended that the stomach be filled

original: phyed dam sum cha bkang ba bsngags //🔽kha zas shin tu yang ba yang //
analyzed: phyed dam sum cha bkang ba bsngags // kha zas shin tu yang ba yang //
translated: one-third with food, one-third with water,🔽and leave one-third for the movement of the wind.🔽Even very light food should not be eaten

original: shin tu 'drangs par mi sbyin no //🔽de ltar tshad las tshad min par //
analyzed: shin tu 'drangs par mi sbyin no // de ltar tshad las tshad min par //
translated: to the point of complete satisfaction.

original: lhag pa'am chung par gyur pa ni //🔽stobs dang snying stobs blo dang ni //
analyzed: lhag pa'am chung par gyur pa ni // stobs dang snying stobs blo dang ni //
translated: Thus, eating more or less than the right amount🔽harms strength, courage, intelligence,

original: mdog dang dbang po la gnod byed //
analyzed: mdog dang dbang po la gnod byed //
translated: complexion, and the senses.

original: rlung ni 'gags pa'am sbyor bar byed //
analyzed: rlung ni 'gags pa'am sbyor bar byed //
translated: It causes the wind to be blocked or to move,

original: nad skyed byed pa'i mchog yin la //
analyzed: nad skyed byed pa'i mchog yin la //
translated: and is the best producer of disease.🔽It leads to a bad taste in the mouth, a short life,

original: ro mi tsa zhing tshe thung dang // mdangs med bkra mi shis par 'gyur //🔽de bas rta rnams log pa yi //
analyzed: ro mi tsa zhing tshe thung dang // mdangs med bkra mi shis par 'gyur // de bas rta rnams log pa yi //
translated: a lack of luster, and inauspiciousness.

original: zas la spyod lam bzlog par bya //
analyzed: zas la spyod lam bzlog par bya //
translated: Therefore, one should avoid eating

original: 'drangs drags par ni gyur pa las //🔽nad gzhi thams cad 'khrug byed cing //
analyzed: 'drangs drags par ni gyur pa las // nad gzhi thams cad 'khrug byed cing //
translated: when one is already full.🔽Eating too much disturbs all the humors

original: gsud dang pho ba'i nad skyes pas //
analyzed: gsud dang pho ba'i nad skyes pas //
translated: and causes vomiting and stomach ailments.🔽One should avoid eating

original: rta ni de las bzlog par bya //
analyzed: rta ni de las bzlog par bya //
translated: when one is already full.

original: ji tsam gyis ni lto ba'i me //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis ni lto ba'i me //
translated: To what extent does the stomach fire

original: 'bar gyur de tsam sbyin par bya //
analyzed: 'bar gyur de tsam sbyin par bya //
translated: One should give to that extent, so that it burns.

original: tshad mi ldan par byin pa yis //
analyzed: tshad mi ldan par byin pa yis //
translated: By giving in an improper way,

original: yang na drags pa'am chung bar 'gyur //🔽rdzas ni chu skyes rlan can dang // skam par skye ste gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: yang na drags pa'am chung bar 'gyur // rdzas ni chu skyes rlan can dang // skam par skye ste gsum du 'dod //
translated: it will either be excessive or insufficient.🔽Substances are considered to be of three kinds:

original: de dag tshad mi ldan par ni //
analyzed: de dag tshad mi ldan par ni //
translated: those that grow in water, those that grow in moisture, and those that grow on dry land.🔽Those that grow in water and moisture

original: bza' ba'i bya ba'ang tha dad do //
analyzed: bza' ba'i bya ba'ang tha dad do //
translated: are not suitable for eating raw.

original: mar dang sbrang rtsi mnyam zas sogs //
analyzed: mar dang sbrang rtsi mnyam zas sogs //
translated: Butter, honey, and equal food, etc.

original: tshad mi ldan dang 'dra ba yi //
analyzed: tshad mi ldan dang 'dra ba yi //
translated: are like improper measures.

original: zas kyi smos kyi skom mam ni //🔽snum mam rtsva yi tshod dang ni //
analyzed: zas kyi smos kyi skom mam ni // snum mam rtsva yi tshod dang ni //
translated: If one drinks water, oil, or grass🔽in excess of the proper amount,

original: grang lhags 'dren pa drags pas kyang //
analyzed: grang lhags 'dren pa drags pas kyang //
translated: or if one is exposed to excessive cold or wind,

original: tshad mi ldan par gnod pa skyed //🔽de bas spyi dang khyad par gyi //
analyzed: tshad mi ldan par gnod pa skyed // de bas spyi dang khyad par gyi //
translated: harm will arise from improper measures.🔽Therefore, I will explain

original: tshad ni nga yis bshad par bya //🔽'o lam se bzhi ma sha bzhi //🔽de bzhi la ni sha na ste //
analyzed: tshad ni nga yis bshad par bya // 'o lam se bzhi ma sha bzhi // de bzhi la ni sha na ste //
translated: the general and specific measures.🔽Four se is one ma, four ma is one sha,🔽four sha is one shana,

original: de @183b bzhi la ni su ba sna //
analyzed: de @183b bzhi la ni su ba sna //
translated: four shana is one suba,

original: de nyid zho gnyis zhes bya'o //🔽de bzhi la ni srang gcig ste //
analyzed: de nyid zho gnyis zhes bya'o // de bzhi la ni srang gcig ste //
translated: and that is called two zho.🔽Four of those is one srang,

original: de bzhi la ni phul du bshad //
analyzed: de bzhi la ni phul du bshad //
translated: and four of those is called one phul.

original: phul bzhi la ni bre gang yin //🔽de bzhi la ni bre bzhi ste //
analyzed: phul bzhi la ni bre gang yin // de bzhi la ni bre bzhi ste //
translated: Four of those make one dré.🔽Four of those make one dre.

original: de bzhi la ni dre na yin //
analyzed: de bzhi la ni dre na yin //
translated: Four of those make one khal.

original: 'di ni spyi yi tshad yin la //
analyzed: 'di ni spyi yi tshad yin la //
translated: This is the general measure.

original: gsher rdzas la ni nyis 'gyur bya //
analyzed: gsher rdzas la ni nyis 'gyur bya //
translated: For liquids, double the measure.

original: snum ni tshad kyi phyed du bya //🔽aaksha lag pa'i mthil la sogs //
analyzed: snum ni tshad kyi phyed du bya // aaksha lag pa'i mthil la sogs //
translated: For oil, take half the measure.

original: zho gnyis kyi ni ming yin no //🔽srang phyed ming ni aa smur bcas //
analyzed: zho gnyis kyi ni ming yin no // srang phyed ming ni aa smur bcas //
translated: Aksha is the name for two seers.🔽Half a srang is called a smu.

original: srang gcig au dumw'a ra ba shad //
analyzed: srang gcig au dumw'a ra ba shad //
translated: One srang is called an udumbara.

original: srang gnyis khyor gang zhes byar bshad //
analyzed: srang gnyis khyor gang zhes byar bshad //
translated: Two srangs is explained as one khyor.

original: de gnyis pa ni gnyis par bshad //🔽de la rtsva skam dag las srang //
analyzed: de gnyis pa ni gnyis par bshad // de la rtsva skam dag las srang //
translated: Two of those is explained as one khal.🔽In that, eight hundred srangs of dry grass

original: brgyad brgya ta la ran pa yin //🔽rlon pa de'i 'dab snye mar bcas //
analyzed: brgyad brgya ta la ran pa yin // rlon pa de'i 'dab snye mar bcas //
translated: is the measure for one tala.🔽Four hundred of wet grass, with leaves and ears,

original: bzhi brgya nyin mtshan gcig la ran //
analyzed: bzhi brgya nyin mtshan gcig la ran //
translated: is the measure for one day and night.

original: thug sogs la ni bre bzhi tsam //
analyzed: thug sogs la ni bre bzhi tsam //
translated: For gruel and so forth, it is just four dre.

original: bza' skam bre ni phye dang gnyis //
analyzed: bza' skam bre ni phye dang gnyis //
translated: For dry food, it is two dre and a phul.

original: snum las phul gang btung ba ni //
analyzed: snum las phul gang btung ba ni //
translated: For oil, one phul is to be drunk.

original: bre gang sbyin par shes par bya //
analyzed: bre gang sbyin par shes par bya //
translated: One dre is to be given as alms.

original: sbrang rtsi las ni phul gang sbyin //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi las ni phul gang sbyin //
translated: For honey, one phul is to be given.

original: bu ram las ni srang brgyad sbyin //
analyzed: bu ram las ni srang brgyad sbyin //
translated: For molasses, give eight ounces.

original: hvags dang kha ra gang yin pa //🔽srang ni bcu yi tshad du sbyin //
analyzed: hvags dang kha ra gang yin pa // srang ni bcu yi tshad du sbyin //
translated: For any type of jaggery,🔽give ten ounces.

original: sna sman khu ba phul gang ste //
analyzed: sna sman khu ba phul gang ste //
translated: For nasal medication, give one prastha.

original: snum gyi sna sman de yi phyed //
analyzed: snum gyi sna sman de yi phyed //
translated: For oily nasal medication, give half that amount.

original: du bas bdug la zho drug ste //
analyzed: du bas bdug la zho drug ste //
translated: For fumigation, give six palas.

original: du ba drag po zho gnyis tshad //
analyzed: du ba drag po zho gnyis tshad //
translated: For strong fumigation, give two palas.

original: sman kha'i gong bu srang bzhi dag / bad kan nad la sbyin par bya //
analyzed: sman kha'i gong bu srang bzhi dag / bad kan nad la sbyin par bya //
translated: For medicinal balls, give four ounces.🔽For treating kapha disorders, give one prastha of beer.

original: rta la dgongs ka btung bar ni //🔽chang ni bre gang blud par bya //🔽rta rnams la ni phye ma'i sman //
analyzed: rta la dgongs ka btung bar ni // chang ni bre gang blud par bya // rta rnams la ni phye ma'i sman //
translated: For a horse, give one drona of beer.

original: btags pa srang gnyis sbyin par bya //
analyzed: btags pa srang gnyis sbyin par bya //
translated: For horses, give two ounces of powdered medicine.

original: zas dang snum ni mnyam byin tshe //
analyzed: zas dang snum ni mnyam byin tshe //
translated: When giving food and oil together,

original: skom du chang ni blud par bya //🔽rta la lan tshva srang lnga yi //
analyzed: skom du chang ni blud par bya // rta la lan tshva srang lnga yi //
translated: give beer to drink.

original: tshad du rab tu sbyin par bya //
analyzed: tshad du rab tu sbyin par bya //
translated: For horses, give five ounces of salt.

original: lus kun bsku byug bya ba yang //🔽snum ni bre dang sbyar bar bya //🔽rna ba kang la yang snum dag ni //
analyzed: lus kun bsku byug bya ba yang // snum ni bre dang sbyar bar bya // rna ba kang la yang snum dag ni //
translated: For all-over body massage,🔽mix oil with one drona.

original: srang gnyis nye bar gzhug par bya //
analyzed: srang gnyis nye bar gzhug par bya //
translated: For the ears, apply two ounces of oil.

original: bsku ba'i snum la sman las ni //
analyzed: bsku ba'i snum la sman las ni //
translated: For the oil to be used for anointing, one should add

original: srang brgya phye mar btags pa gzhug /
analyzed: srang brgya phye mar btags pa gzhug /
translated: one hundred palas of medicinal powders.🔽From the powders, one should add one drona of flour,

original: phye las bre ni do dag dang // de ru bu ram srang brgyad gzhug / mar las phul do bsres pa yi //
analyzed: phye las bre ni do dag dang // de ru bu ram srang brgyad gzhug / mar las phul do bsres pa yi //
translated: eight palas of jaggery, and one prastha of ghee mixed with oil.

original: skyo ma dag ni sbyin par bya //
analyzed: skyo ma dag ni sbyin par bya //
translated: This should be given as a gruel.

original: chu skyes sha ni srang lnga bcu //
analyzed: chu skyes sha ni srang lnga bcu //
translated: For the meat of aquatic animals, fifty palas,

original: rlan can sha ni srang bdun cu //
analyzed: rlan can sha ni srang bdun cu //
translated: for moist meat, seventy palas,

original: skam pa'i sha ni srang dgu bcu //
analyzed: skam pa'i sha ni srang dgu bcu //
translated: and for dry meat, ninety palas.

original: sha yi kha zas tshad yin no //
analyzed: sha yi kha zas tshad yin no //
translated: This is the standard for meat food.

original: khrag bre do la rgyam @184a * //🔽tsha ni // srang gnyis nye bar gzhug bya zhing //
analyzed: khrag bre do la rgyam @184a * // tsha ni // srang gnyis nye bar gzhug bya zhing //
translated: For blood, two dre of salt

original: snum yang srang gnyis bcug pa ni //
analyzed: snum yang srang gnyis bcug pa ni //
translated: should be added, and two palas of oil.

original: khrag zad pa la sbyin par bya //🔽mas gtong ba la bre gang tsam //🔽dum bu gsum du byas te gtong //
analyzed: khrag zad pa la sbyin par bya // mas gtong ba la bre gang tsam // dum bu gsum du byas te gtong //
translated: This should be given for loss of blood.🔽For purgation, one should give one drona,🔽divided into three parts.

original: btags pa las ni srang gsum tsam //
analyzed: btags pa las ni srang gsum tsam //
translated: From the powders, about three palas,

original: srang re ru ni bcad de gtong //
analyzed: srang re ru ni bcad de gtong //
translated: divided into one pala each, should be given.

original: 'jam rtsi phul bzhi gtang bar bya //🔽'jam rtsi'i gong ma phul gang gtong //
analyzed: 'jam rtsi phul bzhi gtang bar bya // 'jam rtsi'i gong ma phul gang gtong //
translated: Four prasthas of oil should be given.🔽One prastha of oil should be given before the oil.

original: mar la 'jam rtsi gtong ba ni //
analyzed: mar la 'jam rtsi gtong ba ni //
translated: For oil enemas,

original: phul do dag ni bya bar bshad //
analyzed: phul do dag ni bya bar bshad //
translated: The best is said to be the action.

original: sman ni srang bzhi'i tshad dag ni //
analyzed: sman ni srang bzhi'i tshad dag ni //
translated: The medicine is four ounces

original: chu srang sum cu rtsa gnyis bskol //
analyzed: chu srang sum cu rtsa gnyis bskol //
translated: Boiled with thirty-two ounces of water.

original: bzhi cha lus par byas pa dag ;
analyzed: bzhi cha lus par byas pa dag ;
translated: One-fourth should be left

original: /'di yi sman khu yin par bshad //
analyzed: /'di yi sman khu yin par bshad //
translated: This is said to be the medicine decoction.

original: chu sman bcu drug 'gyur nang du //
analyzed: chu sman bcu drug 'gyur nang du //
translated: In sixteen parts of water and medicine,

original: bskol ba'i sman ni srang brgya gzhug / snum yang srang brgya bcug nas ni //
analyzed: bskol ba'i sman ni srang brgya gzhug / snum yang srang brgya bcug nas ni //
translated: Add one hundred ounces of oil

original: bzhi cha cha gsum bsrub par bya //
analyzed: bzhi cha cha gsum bsrub par bya //
translated: And churn one-fourth of the three parts.

original: der ni snum gyi bzhi cha yi //
analyzed: der ni snum gyi bzhi cha yi //
translated: There, one-fourth of the oil

original: sman phye bcug la lde gur bya //
analyzed: sman phye bcug la lde gur bya //
translated: Add the medicine powder and make a paste.

original: de la sha khu 'o ma ni //
analyzed: de la sha khu 'o ma ni //
translated: To that, add meat soup and milk

original: chu yi bzhi cha gzhug par bya //
analyzed: chu yi bzhi cha gzhug par bya //
translated: One-fourth of the water.

original: bskol chu sman dang spyar ba yang //
analyzed: bskol chu sman dang spyar ba yang //
translated: The boiled water and medicine mixture

original: zhag lon pa ni spang bar bya //
analyzed: zhag lon pa ni spang bar bya //
translated: Should be discarded after one day.🔽If the sugar is cool to the touch

original: bu ram bsil du 'dod pa dang // bsregs na sgra mi 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: bu ram bsil du 'dod pa dang // bsregs na sgra mi 'byung ba yi //
translated: And makes no sound when struck,

original: mtshan ma de dang dang bar ni //
analyzed: mtshan ma de dang dang bar ni //
translated: And if those signs and clarity

original: snang na thob la dpog par bya //
analyzed: snang na thob la dpog par bya //
translated: Are seen, it is ready and should be measured.

original: de ni tshos pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni tshos pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is cooked,

original: snum de slar ni dbab par bya //
analyzed: snum de slar ni dbab par bya //
translated: That oil should be extracted again.

original: de ni btsags par gyur na ni //
analyzed: de ni btsags par gyur na ni //
translated: If it is strained,

original: yon tan lhag par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: yon tan lhag par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: it becomes superior in quality.🔽When it is oily, clear,

original: snum zhing dang bar 'gyur ba dang // gsal bar gyur na mkhas pa yis //🔽snum de mdog ni phyin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: snum zhing dang bar 'gyur ba dang // gsal bar gyur na mkhas pa yis // snum de mdog ni phyin pa'i phyir //
translated: and bright, the wise🔽should know that the oil has been cooked

original: tshos pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: tshos pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: by the color changing.

original: de 'dra nad kun 'joms byed yin //
analyzed: de 'dra nad kun 'joms byed yin //
translated: This is the remedy for all diseases.🔽The uncooked oil mixed with water

original: ma tshos chu dang 'dres pa dang // tshos drags nag por gyur pa ni //
analyzed: ma tshos chu dang 'dres pa dang // tshos drags nag por gyur pa ni //
translated: and the overcooked, black oil

original: nad kun 'khrugs par byed pa yin //
analyzed: nad kun 'khrugs par byed pa yin //
translated: aggravate all diseases.

original: rma dang sna sman 'jam rtsi la //
analyzed: rma dang sna sman 'jam rtsi la //
translated: For wounds, nasal medication, and ointments,

original: 'jam par tshos pa gtang bar bya //
analyzed: 'jam par tshos pa gtang bar bya //
translated: use oil that is cooked to a soft consistency.

original: bsku la tshos drags btung ba la //
analyzed: bsku la tshos drags btung ba la //
translated: For bathing, overcooked oil

original: bar ma tsam ni bsngags pa yin //
analyzed: bar ma tsam ni bsngags pa yin //
translated: is recommended.

original: ma tshos snum ni nad skyed la //🔽tshos drags phan pa med pa yin //
analyzed: ma tshos snum ni nad skyed la // tshos drags phan pa med pa yin //
translated: Uncooked oil produces diseases,🔽and overcooked oil is ineffective.

original: legs par tshos pa'i snum dag ni //
analyzed: legs par tshos pa'i snum dag ni //
translated: Well-cooked oils

original: rta yi nad ni 'jig byed yin //
analyzed: rta yi nad ni 'jig byed yin //
translated: destroy horse diseases.

original: rlung mkhris bad kan sel ba'i snum //
analyzed: rlung mkhris bad kan sel ba'i snum //
translated: Oils that cure wind, bile, and phlegm

original: btung dang bsku dang sna sman dang // rma dang 'jam rtsi @184b las rnams te //
analyzed: btung dang bsku dang sna sman dang // rma dang 'jam rtsi @184b las rnams te //
translated: wounds, and ointments—

original: rnam pa lnga la gtang bar bya //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga la gtang bar bya //
translated: these are the five types that should be given.

original: tshad 'di dag ni rta rnams las //🔽mchog gi yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: tshad 'di dag ni rta rnams las // mchog gi yin par shes par bya //
translated: These are the measures for the best of horses.

original: bar ma la ni bzhi cha dbri //
analyzed: bar ma la ni bzhi cha dbri //
translated: For the middling, subtract a quarter,

original: tha ma la ni phyed dbri'o //
analyzed: tha ma la ni phyed dbri'o //
translated: and for the lowest, subtract half.🔽The rules for individual food and drink,

original: so so'i zas skom cho ga dang // sum gyi cho ga tha dad pas //
analyzed: so so'i zas skom cho ga dang // sum gyi cho ga tha dad pas //
translated: and the different rules for the three,

original: nad rnams zhi ba nyid 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: nad rnams zhi ba nyid 'gyur gyi //
translated: will lead to the pacification of illnesses.

original: kun la gcig ni bsngags ma yin //
analyzed: kun la gcig ni bsngags ma yin //
translated: But none is recommended for all.

original: autpa la ni kha 'byed pa //
analyzed: autpa la ni kha 'byed pa //
translated: The opening of the utpala

original: zla ba'i 'od zer nyid yin la //🔽nyi ma'i zer gyis padma ni //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od zer nyid yin la // nyi ma'i zer gyis padma ni //
translated: is due to the light rays of the moon,🔽and the opening of the lotus

original: kha 'byed par ni snang ba yin //
analyzed: kha 'byed par ni snang ba yin //
translated: is seen to be due to the sun's rays.

original: tshad ni me stobs las shes bya //
analyzed: tshad ni me stobs las shes bya //
translated: The measure should be known from the strength of the fire.

original: ji dga' sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji dga' sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not give as one pleases.

original: me drod de yang rnam bzhi ste //
analyzed: me drod de yang rnam bzhi ste //
translated: That digestive heat is also of four types:

original: rno rtul mnyam dang mi mnyam pa'o //🔽rno bas shin tu myur du 'ju //
analyzed: rno rtul mnyam dang mi mnyam pa'o // rno bas shin tu myur du 'ju //
translated: sharp, dull, equal, and unequal.🔽The sharp one digests very quickly,

original: rtul bas dka' bas 'ju ba yin //
analyzed: rtul bas dka' bas 'ju ba yin //
translated: and the dull one digests with difficulty.

original: ma snyoms pas ni 'ju mi snyoms //
analyzed: ma snyoms pas ni 'ju mi snyoms //
translated: If the digestive heat is uneven, digestion will be uneven.

original: snyoms pas 'ju ba snyoms pa yin //
analyzed: snyoms pas 'ju ba snyoms pa yin //
translated: If it is even, digestion will be even.

original: me drod rtul bas gzi mdangs mdog / dang po dang ni 'gros zhan 'gyur //
analyzed: me drod rtul bas gzi mdangs mdog / dang po dang ni 'gros zhan 'gyur //
translated: If the digestive heat is weak, one’s complexion and strength will be weak.

original: me drod rno bas de rnams dang // ldan zhing nad ni nyung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: me drod rno bas de rnams dang // ldan zhing nad ni nyung bar 'gyur //
translated: If the digestive heat is sharp, one will have these qualities and few illnesses.

original: me drod snyoms pas snying stobs mdog / nad med 'gros dang skad dang ni //
analyzed: me drod snyoms pas snying stobs mdog / nad med 'gros dang skad dang ni //
translated: If the digestive heat is even, one will have courage, a good complexion, good health, good gait, and a good voice.

original: dbang po bde ldan nad med 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang po bde ldan nad med 'gyur //
translated: One will have healthy senses and be free from illness.

original: me drod mi snyoms skad dang mdog / stobs chung nad ni mang ba dang // bde ba med par 'gyur ro zhes //
analyzed: me drod mi snyoms skad dang mdog / stobs chung nad ni mang ba dang // bde ba med par 'gyur ro zhes //
translated: If the digestive heat is uneven, one’s voice, complexion, and strength will be weak, one will have many illnesses, and one will be unhappy.

original: sha li ho tras rjes su bstan //
analyzed: sha li ho tras rjes su bstan //
translated: This was taught by Śālihotra.

original: sha li ho tra'i mdo'i gnas las tshad kyi le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'o /🔽// / rta bres la ni legs gnas pa'i //
analyzed: sha li ho tra'i mdo'i gnas las tshad kyi le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'o / // / rta bres la ni legs gnas pa'i //
translated: This concludes the chapter on pulse examination, the fourteenth in the “Instruction by the Master of Medicine,” a commentary on the Explanatory Tantra.🔽The great sage, the one who has conquered the senses,

original: drang srong chen po dbang po thul //
analyzed: drang srong chen po dbang po thul //
translated: who is well-established in the horse’s mouth,

original: me la sbyin sreg byed brtson la //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg byed brtson la //
translated: who is diligent in fire offerings,

original: legs thos la sogs kyis dris pa //
analyzed: legs thos la sogs kyis dris pa //
translated: was asked by Bṛhaspati and others:

original: tshod shis gang gi don 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: tshod shis gang gi don 'gyur zhing //
translated: “What is the meaning of pulse examination?

original: gang gi yon tan skyon bshad pa //🔽de yi zas kyi bya ba ni //
analyzed: gang gi yon tan skyon bshad pa // de yi zas kyi bya ba ni //
translated: The one who explains the good qualities and faults,🔽Please tell us the function of food

original: lus dang des 'brel bka' stsol cig / de skad sha li ho tra la //
analyzed: lus dang des 'brel bka' stsol cig / de skad sha li ho tra la //
translated: and the body and what is connected to it.

original: drang srong dam pa bus dris tshe //
analyzed: drang srong dam pa bus dris tshe //
translated: When the supreme sage was asked by his son🔽in this way,

original: zas kyi sbyor ba drang srong che //
analyzed: zas kyi sbyor ba drang srong che //
translated: the great sage,🔽endowed with radiance,

original: mdangs dang ldan pas slar smras pa //
analyzed: mdangs dang ldan pas slar smras pa //
translated: replied:

original: zas kyi sbyor bas kha dog mdangs //
analyzed: zas kyi sbyor bas kha dog mdangs //
translated: The combination of food gives rise to complexion, radiance,🔽speed, beauty, courage, memory,🔽satisfaction, and a joyful mind,

original: mgyogs mdzes snying stobs dran pa dang // 'drangs dang sems ni dga' ba dang // na tshod la ni 'jog pa yin //
analyzed: mgyogs mdzes snying stobs dran pa dang // 'drangs dang sems ni dga' ba dang // na tshod la ni 'jog pa yin //
translated: and maintains youthfulness.

original: la la 'tsham dang mi @185a * //
analyzed: la la 'tsham dang mi @185a * //
translated: Some are comfortable and some uncomfortable;

original: 'tsham dang // zas kyi sbyor bas bde 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: 'tsham dang // zas kyi sbyor bas bde 'gyur ba'i //
translated: the combination of food brings happiness.

original: sbyor ba'i cho ga bshad par bya //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i cho ga bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain the ritual of combining.

original: bshad pa de ni mnyan par gyis //🔽me drod chung dang yid mi bde //

original: lto ba na dang dbugs mi bde //
analyzed: lto ba na dang dbugs mi bde //

original: dub cing khal gyis nyen pa dang // dug 'thungs pa dang skams pa dang ; / lam 'gro mtshan ni mi ldang dang // dub la'ang kha zas mi sbyin no //
analyzed: dub cing khal gyis nyen pa dang // dug 'thungs pa dang skams pa dang ; / lam 'gro mtshan ni mi ldang dang // dub la'ang kha zas mi sbyin no //
translated: One should not give food to those who are tired and burdened, who have drunk poison, who are thirsty, who are traveling, who are standing, and who are tired.

original: stobs ldan lci ba'i kha zas ni //🔽de la sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stobs ldan lci ba'i kha zas ni // de la sbyin par mi bya'o //

analyzed: lam gyis nyam chung gyur stobs bri //

original: rgan dang rab gzhon dbang nyam chung //
analyzed: rgan dang rab gzhon dbang nyam chung //

analyzed: rtsa dang 'bras dang glo gcong can //

original: zas sbyor rtag tu bya bar rigs //
analyzed: zas sbyor rtag tu bya bar rigs //

analyzed: gang tshe phyi dro'i dus su ni //

analyzed: 'bras bre gang ni legs btsos la //

analyzed: ne tsho'i sgro gshog 'dra ba dang // mar gyi snying po'i mdog 'dra dang // padma'i sa bon mdog 'dra dang // padma'i ge sar lta bu dang // de bzhin me yi rtse 'dra dang // gang zhig gzha' dang 'dra ba dang // gang yang ba bla 'dra ba dang // spu ti ka yi ser po 'dra //
translated: like a flame,🔽like a rainbow,🔽like a white blanket,🔽like a puṭṭīka flower,

original: shri sha'i me tog 'dra ba dang // @190a * //
analyzed: shri sha'i me tog 'dra ba dang // @190a * //

analyzed: gang yang khre 'bras mdog 'dra dang // gang yang spyang khu'i mdog can dang // kha dog ser po ji snyed dang // gzhan yang ser po dang 'dres dang // de 'dra de las gzhan pa dag / rta ni ser po dang 'dres mdog / de ltar rnam pa bzhi po ni //
translated: and those that are similar to those,🔽are horses that are mixed with yellow.🔽Thus, these four

analyzed: mdog 'dres pa zhes bya bar bshad //

analyzed: gzhan yang kha dog dbye ba dang // kha dog sna tshogs mnyan par gyis //

original: phug ron gyi ni ske 'dra zhing //
analyzed: phug ron gyi ni ske 'dra zhing //

analyzed: pags pa spu yi mdog dmar pa //

analyzed: phug ron ske 'dra phug ro na ske //

analyzed: dmar dang nag po cung zad 'dres //

original: pags pa rnga ma rngog ma gnag /
analyzed: pags pa rnga ma rngog ma gnag /

analyzed: mig dang gsang ba rmig pa'ang gnag / mkhal ma'i mdog 'dra nag 'tsher ba //

analyzed: 'di nyid gnag pa'i shas che ba //

analyzed: nag 'tshor ba ni yin zhes bya //

analyzed: gal te mar nag tsham mnyam 'dres //

analyzed: rgun 'bru ltar 'tsher yin par bshad //

original: rgun 'bru ltar 'tsher de nyid la //
analyzed: rgun 'bru ltar 'tsher de nyid la //

original: cung zad ser skyas 'dres pa ni //
analyzed: cung zad ser skyas 'dres pa ni //

analyzed: gang zhig shas che le la gdangs //

analyzed: nag po dkar po dang 'dres shing //

original: pags pa nag por 'dug pa ni //
analyzed: pags pa nag por 'dug pa ni //

analyzed: spu 'dres rang srong pa zhes bshad //

original: gsal pa ri dgas mdog can yin //
analyzed: gsal pa ri dgas mdog can yin //

analyzed: de nyid dkar po ma gyur na //

analyzed: dkar po'i drang srong pa zhes bshad //

original: de ni skya ba'i drang srong pa //

original: dkar dang dmar dang nag por 'dres //
analyzed: dkar dang dmar dang nag por 'dres //

analyzed: pags pa nag po yod gyur cig / mig dang pho mtshan rmig pa gnag //

analyzed: ser skya'i ba 'dra ser skya yin //

analyzed: nag po dmar pos khyab gyur cing //

analyzed: dud ka zhes ni bya bar bshad //

analyzed: rta de mtshal bu zhes byar bshad //

original: gang zhig spu rtse gnag gyur cing //
analyzed: gang zhig spu rtse gnag gyur cing //

analyzed: gzhan dag ser skyar gnas gyur pa //

analyzed: gdong gi mdog ni ma 'dres pa'i //

analyzed: rta de dur pa zhes byar bshad //

analyzed: rta ni se po zhes byar bshad //

analyzed: dkar dang ser ba'i mdog 'dres shing //

original: ser la dkar shas che ba ni //
analyzed: ser la dkar shas che ba ni //

analyzed: khan dza te zhes bya ba yin //

analyzed: gos ni srab mos bkab pa ltar //

analyzed: rta de 'khor long can zhes bya / kha dog mang po dang ldan zhing //

analyzed: brgyan pa lta bur snad ba ni //

analyzed: rta de khra bo zhes bshad do //

analyzed: rta yi rkang pa bzhi dang ni //

analyzed: dmar ba'am dkar ba'i 'khor ling ngam //

analyzed: nag pa'am kha dog gzhan dag las //

analyzed: kha dog dang ni rjes mthun par //

analyzed: de las ming du gdags par bya // gang gis kha dog gang dag la //

analyzed: mdog gis 'dres par gyur na yang // mdog gi shas ni gang che ba //
translated: If the colors are mixed,🔽then the color that predominates

analyzed: de yi mdog las gdags par bya //

original: gang zhig mdangs snum brtan zhing gsal //
analyzed: gang zhig mdangs snum brtan zhing gsal //

original: kha dog de ni thams cad bsngags //
analyzed: kha dog de ni thams cad bsngags //

original: de nas dkar ba mchog yin la //
analyzed: de nas dkar ba mchog yin la //

analyzed: de dang ldan pa gzhan yang bzang //

analyzed: rta yi kha dog thams cad las //

analyzed: kha dog dkar po mi 'gyur yin //

original: brtan zhing mi zad nyid kyis na //
analyzed: brtan zhing mi zad nyid kyis na //

original: dkar po nyid ni khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: dkar po nyid ni khyad par 'phags //

original: de ltar rta yi kha dog ni //
analyzed: de ltar rta yi kha dog ni //

analyzed: mdor bsdus nas ni bstan pa yin ; / kha dog dbye ba ma lus par //
translated: have been taught in brief.🔽It is not possible to describe

original: smra bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smra bar nus pa ma yin no //

analyzed: sha li ho tra'i mdo'i gnas las kha dog shes par bya ba'i le'u ste bco brgyad pa'o / // / sha li ho tra thub mchog la //
translated: This concludes the eighteenth chapter, on knowing colors, from The Verse Commentary on the Chapters of the Śālihotrī Dharma Sūtra.

original: legs thos kyis ni yang dris pa //
analyzed: legs thos kyis ni yang dris pa //

analyzed: zhur dang de bzhin rgyal mtshan @191a * //

analyzed: dag ; ji ltar gnas pa bka' stsol cig / de ltar dris tshe legs thos la //

original: sha li ho tras slar smras pa //
analyzed: sha li ho tras slar smras pa //

original: mchu sgros ltag nas dpral mtshams bar //
analyzed: mchu sgros ltag nas dpral mtshams bar //

analyzed: dkar ba'am shin tu dkar gang yin //

original: der ni zhu bor shes bya ste //
analyzed: der ni zhu bor shes bya ste //

analyzed: 'di yis 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi yin //

analyzed: gnas dang dbyibs dang kha dog dang // rang bzhin las shis mi shis 'gyur //

original: khur ba de yi 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: khur ba de yi 'bras bu ni //

original: rim pa bzhin du bshad par bya //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du bshad par bya //

analyzed: mchu ltag dpral ba sna gdong dang // gzhan yang mchu ltag gdong pa dang // mchu ltag phum phum mthar thug de //
translated: the lips, forehead, and the end of the hump,

analyzed: rta yi gdong pa kun dkar ba //
translated: if the horse's face is completely white,

original: rigs kyi dbang phyug 'phel byed yin //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbang phyug 'phel byed yin //

original: mgo bo rna bar bcas dkar ba //
analyzed: mgo bo rna bar bcas dkar ba //

original: bdag po bde ba kun skyed de //
analyzed: bdag po bde ba kun skyed de //

original: gnas gnyis na ni gnas pa'i 'bras //
analyzed: gnas gnyis na ni gnas pa'i 'bras //
translated: The result of being in two places🔽is explained as follows:

analyzed: me long lcags kyu bum pa dang // gdugs dang rnga yab 'dra ba dang // dpal shing rim gyis 'phel 'dra dang // bum pa g-yung drung dbyibs 'dra ba'i //

original: zhur ni gang gi rta la yod //
analyzed: zhur ni gang gi rta la yod //
translated: If it has these, the king will ride it.

original: bu tsha bran dang mdza' bo 'phel //
analyzed: bu tsha bran dang mdza' bo 'phel //

original: rgyal pos legs par bkur gyur la //
analyzed: rgyal pos legs par bkur gyur la //

original: rta yang bde bar 'tsho bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rta yang bde bar 'tsho bar 'gyur //

original: zhur ni byang chub shing lo 'dra //
analyzed: zhur ni byang chub shing lo 'dra //

original: de yis skal ba bzang 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de yis skal ba bzang 'gyur zhing //

original: bu ni mang po yod par 'gyur //🔽zur bzhi yod na rgyal pos ni //
analyzed: bu ni mang po yod par 'gyur // zur bzhi yod na rgyal pos ni //
translated: He will have many children.🔽If there are four corners,

original: yul khams rnyed par ston pa yin //🔽ral gri 'khor lo rdo rje gzhu //
analyzed: yul khams rnyed par ston pa yin // ral gri 'khor lo rdo rje gzhu //
translated: the king will find a kingdom.🔽The shape of the horse’s withers is like a sword, a discus, a vajra, a bow,🔽a plow, a pestle, a club,

original: gshol dang gtun shing dbyig pa dang // rgyal mtshan ba dan gdugs 'dra ba //
analyzed: gshol dang gtun shing dbyig pa dang // rgyal mtshan ba dan gdugs 'dra ba //

analyzed: zhur la dbyibs yod rgyal po yis //

analyzed: zhon na g-yul las rgyal byed yin //

original: rta de bzhon nas rgyal po yis //
analyzed: rta de bzhon nas rgyal po yis //

analyzed: dgra rnams thul bar 'gyur ba yin //

analyzed: kha khyer gyi ni dbyibs 'dra ba'i //

analyzed: zhur yod bdag pos 'bras chen thob //

analyzed: me tog mgo lcogs dbyibs 'dra ba //

analyzed: @191b me tog padma'i dbyibs 'dra ba'i // mig mngas ris kyi dbyibs yod pa //

analyzed: bdag po bkur sti nor mang dge / shing rta'i dbyibs 'dra'i zhur yod pa'i //

analyzed: rta ni nor rnams 'phel byed yin //

analyzed: steng cha kha zheng che ba'i zhur //

original: nor dang 'bru dang phrad byed do //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru dang phrad byed do //

analyzed: de yi bdag pos dpal thob cing //

original: bu dang tsha bo rnam par 'phel //
analyzed: bu dang tsha bo rnam par 'phel //

original: de yi khyim du dpal rtag gnas //
analyzed: de yi khyim du dpal rtag gnas //

original: rgyal srid kyang ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal srid kyang ni thob par 'gyur //

original: rta de ci 'dod ma smas par //
analyzed: rta de ci 'dod ma smas par //

original: bde bar 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: bde bar 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur //

original: mi shis pa yi mtshan rtags ni //
analyzed: mi shis pa yi mtshan rtags ni //
translated: The signs of inauspiciousness:🔽The horse has a mixed color on the jaw,

original: rta'i zhur kha dog 'dres pa dang // g-yon ngogs 'gram glang bar du chags //
analyzed: rta'i zhur kha dog 'dres pa dang // g-yon ngogs 'gram glang bar du chags //

analyzed: g-yon pa'i mig dkyus dpral ba'i ngos dang bcas //

original: khyad par skyes pa'i rta de ni //
analyzed: khyad par skyes pa'i rta de ni //
translated: That horse, born with a special mark,

original: dpral chags zhes te dang tshul ngan //
analyzed: dpral chags zhes te dang tshul ngan //

analyzed: rgyun du dang nga zhing 'thab rtsod dga' bar 'gyur //

original: mur 'gram dag tu chags pa'i rta yang smad //
analyzed: mur 'gram dag tu chags pa'i rta yang smad //

analyzed: gdong bar dbyig 'dra'i zhur chags dang // g-yon ngos che zhing cung zad dang // dbus na lcags sgrog 'dra yod pa //

analyzed: rta de bde bar mi 'gyur ro // de yi bdag po thag pa'am //

original: lcags sgrog gis ni bcing bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lcags sgrog gis ni bcing bar 'gyur //

analyzed: mtshan nyid de 'dras mi 'gor bar //

analyzed: de ni dgra bo'i dbang du 'gyur //

original: 'phred du zheng du che ba'i zhur //
analyzed: 'phred du zheng du che ba'i zhur //

original: nor brlag par ni ston pa yin //
analyzed: nor brlag par ni ston pa yin //

original: nag nog can gyi zhur yod pa //
analyzed: nag nog can gyi zhur yod pa //

analyzed: bdag po'i nor nyi nyams par byed //

analyzed: zhur ba yo dang spub pa dang // chad pa'i zhur yang sdug bsngal skyed //

analyzed: spang leb 'dra dang 'dres pa yi //

analyzed: zhur yod rta yang de dang 'dra // kha dog dkar la mdog gzhan gyi //

analyzed: zhur yod pa ni smad pa yin //

analyzed: nag pos bdag po mi bzad dug / reg pa'ang brlag par byed pa yin //

analyzed: gang zhig glog gi dbyibs 'dra dang // mdung thung gi ni dbyibs 'dra ba'o //
translated: or the shape of a javelin,🔽if it is invisible, or another,

analyzed: de bzhin mi snang gzhan dag dang // srab cing gsal bar mi mngon pa //

analyzed: des ni nor rnams brlag pa dang // 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //

original: mdongs kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa //

original: de dag bshad do nyan par gyis //
analyzed: de dag bshad do nyan par gyis //

original: zla ba'am skar ma 'dra ba yi //
analyzed: zla ba'am skar ma 'dra ba yi //

analyzed: @192a * // mdongs yod bdag po rgyal srid thob //

analyzed: bu dang tsha bo 'phel bar 'gyur // gang gi dga' ba 'khyil 'dra ba'i //
translated: His sons and grandsons will increase.🔽If the mark is like a coiled snake,

analyzed: mdongs yod bdag po nor mang rnyed //

original: bu dang tsha bo 'phel bar byed //

analyzed: mdongs de shis pa skal ba bzang //

original: mi shis pa yang bshad par bya //
analyzed: mi shis pa yang bshad par bya //

analyzed: mgo dang rna ba mig rngog mtha' //

analyzed: kha dog steng du mdog gzhan gyi //

analyzed: rgyal po ne sha tras dris pa // rta la kha dog du ma yi //
translated: King Neśaṭha asked the great sage Śālihotra:🔽“I see many colored

analyzed: de la thig le zhes bya'o //

analyzed: kha dog 'dra ba'i thig le ni // 'jam pa nyid kyi mngon gyur cing //

analyzed: ji ltar shing la me tog ltar //

analyzed: shis pa dang ni mi shis skyed //

analyzed: mdun so ya mchu ma mchu la //

analyzed: snum zhing dkar ba'i kha dog snang //

original: rmig pa rnams la'ang de 'drar chags //

original: mkhas pas des ni zhag bdun na //
analyzed: mkhas pas des ni zhag bdun na //

analyzed: nor thob ltas su shes par bya //

analyzed: che chung las kyi zla phyed ni ;
translated: From the size, in half a month of work,

analyzed: / bdun nam zla ba bdun gyis thob //

original: mchu sgros las ni thig le chags //
analyzed: mchu sgros las ni thig le chags //

analyzed: sas dang skom ni rnyed par bshad //

original: bdag po bde dang longs spyod thob //
analyzed: bdag po bde dang longs spyod thob //

original: 'di yis khyim ni 'phel 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'di yis khyim ni 'phel 'gyur zhing //

original: gter thob par yang snang ba yin //
analyzed: gter thob par yang snang ba yin //

original: shis pa bshad zin 'dres ma nyon //
analyzed: shis pa bshad zin 'dres ma nyon //

original: sna ru byung na mtshon gyis 'chi //
analyzed: sna ru byung na mtshon gyis 'chi //

original: mkhur bar byung na bu nges 'chi //
analyzed: mkhur bar byung na bu nges 'chi //

original: dpral bar byung na nor thob 'gyur //
analyzed: dpral bar byung na nor thob 'gyur //

original: dpral mtshams kyis ni rgyal srid 'gyur //
analyzed: dpral mtshams kyis ni rgyal srid 'gyur //

analyzed: lkog mar byung na zas skom rnyed // mur 'gram dag tu byung na phung //
translated: If it occurs in the throat, food and drink will be found.🔽If it occurs in the jaw, there will be loss.

original: 'chis sran byung na nyer 'tshe byed //🔽mur 'gram za yur byung de 'dra //
analyzed: 'chis sran byung na nyer 'tshe byed // mur 'gram za yur byung de 'dra //
translated: If it occurs in the armpit, there will be harm.🔽If it occurs in the jaw and the corner of the mouth, it is like that.

original: rna ba g-yon pa'i g-yas las 'pho //
analyzed: rna ba g-yon pa'i g-yas las 'pho //
translated: If [the dream] occurs to the right of the left ear,

original: g-yas su byung na mdza' bo 'phel //
analyzed: g-yas su byung na mdza' bo 'phel //

original: ske mjing ltag pa ze mchen du //
analyzed: ske mjing ltag pa ze mchen du //

analyzed: byung na mtshon gyi 'thab mo 'ong // lkog mar byung na rta bdag gis // chung ma dang ni bu rnyed 'gyur //
translated: If it occurs in the throat,🔽one will find a wife and a son.

original: phrag sor byung na bu rnyed do //
analyzed: phrag sor byung na bu rnyed do //
translated: If it occurs in the shoulder or the arm, one will find a son.

original: rtsib logs byung na rang phyogs 'phel //
analyzed: rtsib logs byung na rang phyogs 'phel //
translated: If it occurs in the ribs, one's own side will increase.

original: pus mor byung na gnod pa skyed //
analyzed: pus mor byung na gnod pa skyed //
translated: If it appears at the knees, it produces harm.

original: dpung par byung na mdza' dang phrad //
analyzed: dpung par byung na mdza' dang phrad //
translated: If it appears at the shoulders, it is meeting with friends.

original: g-yon logs kyis ni skrod par byed //
analyzed: g-yon logs kyis ni skrod par byed //
translated: If it is on the left side, it causes banishment.

original: lus kyi stod smad du byung @193a * //
analyzed: lus kyi stod smad du byung @193a * //
translated: If it appears on the upper or lower body,

original: na ; / bdag po phrog par ston pa yin //🔽mchan khung dku yi gnas su byung //
analyzed: na ; / bdag po phrog par ston pa yin // mchan khung dku yi gnas su byung //
translated: it indicates the loss of a master.🔽If it appears at the armpit or the side,

original: ltogs 'gyur ma mchur byung na 'chi //
analyzed: ltogs 'gyur ma mchur byung na 'chi //
translated: one will be hungry. If it appears at the lower lip, one will die.

original: ya mchur byung na mi 'chi la //
analyzed: ya mchur byung na mi 'chi la //
translated: If it appears at the upper lip, one will not die.

original: mig tu byung na gos zas thob //
analyzed: mig tu byung na gos zas thob //
translated: If it appears at the eye, one will obtain clothing and food.🔽If it appears at the eyelashes, the back of the neck, the uvula,

analyzed: ze ba ltag dang ze'u dang // dpyi mgul brla ni phra mo dang // rje ngar dang ni de mtshams su //

original: byung na 'dir ni smad par bshad //
analyzed: byung na 'dir ni smad par bshad //
translated: it is explained here as being contemptible.

original: ske rtsar byung na nor thob cing //
analyzed: ske rtsar byung na nor thob cing //
translated: If it appears at the throat, one obtains wealth.

original: rngog ltag gis ni rgyal srid skyed //
analyzed: rngog ltag gis ni rgyal srid skyed //

original: rgyu mtshams thig le nor rnyed la //
analyzed: rgyu mtshams thig le nor rnyed la //

original: snying gar byung na gcod can 'gyur //
analyzed: snying gar byung na gcod can 'gyur //

original: rtsib logs g-yas byung bud med rnyed //
analyzed: rtsib logs g-yas byung bud med rnyed //

original: mjug dor byung na nor zad 'gyur //
analyzed: mjug dor byung na nor zad 'gyur //

original: rgyur byung na ni skal ba bzang //
analyzed: rgyur byung na ni skal ba bzang //

original: rgyab tu byung na gnas rnams 'phel //
analyzed: rgyab tu byung na gnas rnams 'phel //

original: ltor byung rtogs pa'i 'jigs pa ste //
analyzed: ltor byung rtogs pa'i 'jigs pa ste //

original: rlig par byung na skal bzang rnyed //
analyzed: rlig par byung na skal bzang rnyed //

original: lte ba'i rtsa las dmag dpon 'gyur //
analyzed: lte ba'i rtsa las dmag dpon 'gyur //

original: aong dor byung na chung ma 'phyo //
analyzed: aong dor byung na chung ma 'phyo //

original: rkub dang rnga ma'i rtsa bar byung //
analyzed: rkub dang rnga ma'i rtsa bar byung //
translated: If it appears on the channel of the anus and penis,

original: nor rnams thams cad brlag par 'gyur //
analyzed: nor rnams thams cad brlag par 'gyur //

analyzed: pus mor byung na 'chi ba skyed // lkog ma tshe'u pus lam 'gro ston //

analyzed: rmang kha'i thig les bu skye ston // spyi la bud med nyes pa skyed //
